perturbation.original_text: 1.5 "FIELD OF USE" means, and is limited to, the utilization of the Licensed Technology by the Licensee for the exclusive purpose of  fulfilling Spot FX transactions by transmitting market data and orders. The "Field of Use" shall not include any functions or applications  not expressly described in the preceding sentence, but shall include functions or applications developed by Licensor to enhance the  performance within the "Field of Use".
perturbation.changed_text: 1.5 "FIELD OF USE" means the utilization of the Licensed Technology by the Licensee for fulfilling Spot FX transactions by transmitting market data and orders. The "Field of Use" includes any functions or applications, whether or not expressly described in the preceding sentence, but shall include functions or applications developed by Licensor to enhance the  performance within the "Field of Use".
perturbation.explanation: The original text narrowly defines "FIELD OF USE," limiting it to explicitly described functions for Spot FX transactions. The revised text broadens this definition to include any function or application, regardless of express description, creating a contradiction regarding the scope of permissible use. This uncertainty could lead to disputes about whether specific uses of the Licensed Technology are within the allowed scope.

perturbation.original_text:
VII. The Licensee acknowledges and understands neither, the Licensor, nor any of its respective affiliates, employees,  officers or agents shall assume any responsibility or liability for the system's operations, involving the operations  of any equipment, (including but not limited to computer equipment or peripherals, server equipment,  communication equipment and data lines, all such equipment, collectively referred to herein as the "Equipment").







   The foregoing shall apply regardless of whether a claim arises in contract, tort, negligence, strict  liability or otherwise.     II. Additional Restrictions. The Licensee expressly agrees and acknowledges that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary,  Licensee is not licensed to, and Licensee expressly agrees that it shall not(and shall not permit any third party to);
perturbation.changed_text:
VII. The Licensee acknowledges and understands that the Licensor shall assume responsibility and liability for the system's operations, involving the operations  of any equipment, (including but not limited to computer equipment or peripherals, server equipment,  communication equipment and data lines, all such equipment, collectively referred to herein as the "Equipment").







   The foregoing shall apply regardless of whether a claim arises in contract, tort, negligence, strict  liability or otherwise.     II. Additional Restrictions. The Licensee expressly agrees and acknowledges that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary,  Licensee is not licensed to, and Licensee expressly agrees that it shall not(and shall not permit any third party to);
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that the Licensor assumes no responsibility or liability for the system's operations. The modified version directly contradicts this by stating that the Licensor *shall* assume responsibility and liability. This creates a significant contradiction regarding liability for the system's performance and operation. This would create great uncertainty about liability.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE II - LICENSE GRANT AND RESTRICTIONS - I.ii

perturbation.original_text: ARTICLE VI  SUB LICENSE AGREEMENT        Licensee agrees it shall not exchange, lease, sublease, distribute, assign, sell or otherwise transfer in any manner any right and/or interest  incident to the License Technology to any third party under any circumstances, without the prior written consent of the Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: ARTICLE VI  SUB LICENSE AGREEMENT        Licensee agrees it shall not exchange, lease, sublease, distribute, assign, sell or otherwise transfer in any manner any right and/or interest  incident to the License Technology to any third party under any circumstances, *even* with the prior written consent of the Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits the licensee from transfering or assigning their rights to a third party. The changed text continues this restriction, but then says under no circumstances will there be a transfer, *even* with the licensors permission. This creates confusion as to if or when there can be a transfer or assignment.
